TITLE: The most impressive meteor shower of the year will be visible this weekend
SUMMARY: The Perseid meteor shower is typically the most impressive of the year because it can produce the highest rate of shooting stars in the night sky

TITLE: What caused the Maui wildfires? How drought and wind played a part
SUMMARY: A distant hurricane and severe drought conditions combined to create the kind of disaster that some scientists say show how climate change is a "threat multiplier

TITLE: Summer has been no sweat for California's green energy grid, but the hottest days may lie ahead
SUMMARY: As the state braced for triple-digit temperatures, its energy grid has had a surplus of power with the help of renewable energy, battery storage capacity, and relatively lower demand

TITLE: Youth activists win 'game-changer' case for U.S. climate change protections
SUMMARY: The young activists argued Montana was violating their constitutional right to a clean and healthy environment by permitting fossil fuels without considering the climate

TITLE: Maui fires shocked climate scientists, who now say America isn't ready for today's natural disasters
SUMMARY: From California floods to Maui fires, safety systems that were sometimes designed decades ago are getting overwhelmed by disasters on a scale that was previously hard to imagine

TITLE: U.S. hurricane deaths concentrated in vulnerable counties, research finds
SUMMARY: A study found that almost 94% of hurricane-related deaths were among people who lived in counties that ranked medium to high on the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention’s social vulnerability index

TITLE: The IRA boosted green development, but some say it could be doing more
SUMMARY: Tax credits have helped make going green more economical, but political pressure and unclear guidelines are hampering the Inflation Reduction Act’s success

TITLE: Western states won't lose as much Colorado River water in 2024, but long-term challenges remain
SUMMARY: Conservation measures and a wetter winter have improved the river’s health, leading to cuts' being dialed back

TITLE: Tropical Storm Hilary expected to deluge Southern California with heavy rain
SUMMARY: Conditions are favorable for Hilary to strengthen over the next two to three days

TITLE: First U.S. nuclear reactor built from scratch in decades enters commercial operation in Georgia
SUMMARY: Nuclear power now makes up about 25% of the generation of Georgia Power, the largest unit of Atlanta-based Southern Co
